chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sexual Assault - Intercourse with Person under 12
1st Degree Child Sexual Assault - Intercourse with Person under 12
Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st Degree Sexual Assault)
Cause Child <13 to View/Listen Sex. Act.

result.execSummary:
The defendant Terrance P. Simmons was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13 [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1)(e).
  • Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st Degree Sexual Assault) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.025(1)(d).
  • Cause Child <13 to View/Listen Sex. Act. [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.055(1).
  • Expose Child to Harmful Material [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.11(2)(a).
  • Expose Child to Harmful Material [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.11(2)(a).
  • Expose Child to Harmful Material [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.11(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: GFE at FTE/schooling/combination of the two of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours community service per week.

No contact with victims or any of their immediate family. 

No contact with minors unless approved by the Departmetn and with an approved chaperone in place.

DNA sample. 

Comply with sex offender registry.

Case Called: 1:37 pm 
State appears by DA Theresa Wetzsteon; Deft appears in person, in custody with Atty Benjamin Van Severen. 
COURT notes it has received application and consent to consolidation with Lincoln County case. 
Parties have rec'd PSI and have no additions/corrections. 
COURT notes letters rec'd and parties have reviewed those letters. 
VRCW. 
N.K. makes statement. 
N.J. makes statement. 
P.T. makes statement. 
S.G. makes statement. 
Argument by the State. 
OTR: 2:57 pm BOTR: 3:17 pm 
Argument by Atty Van Severen. 

COURT ORDERS: 
On Ct. 1>>22 yrs imprisonment - 12 yrs IC & 10 yrs ES. 
On Ct. 2>>22 yrs imprisonment - 12 yrs IC & 10 yrs ES. 
On Ct. 3>>10 yrs imprisonment - 5 yrs IC & 5 yrs ES. 
On Ct. 4>>3.5 yrs imprisonment - 1.5 yrs IC & 2 yrs ES. 
On Ct. 5>>3.5 yrs imprisonment - 1.5 yrs IC & 2 yrs ES. 
On Ct. 6>>3.5 yrs imprisonment - 1.5 yrs IC & 2 yrs ES. 

COURT ORDERS as CONDITIONS OF ES>>DNA sample/surcharge; no contact with victims or any of their immediate family; no contact with minors unless approved by the dept and with an approved chaperone in place; good faith fulltime employment/school/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours CS per week; comply with sex offender registry; CC. 

COURT finds the deft NOT eligible for CIP and SAP. 
COURT finds the deft entitled to 1334 days credit on Ct. 1. 
COURT ORDERS sentences on Cts. 1 & 2 to run consecutive and sentences on Cts. 3-6 to run CONCURENT to each other and to Ct. 1. 

COURT advises parties to maintain confidentiality of PSI. 
COURT remands deft into custody for transport.

State notes Atty Wright Laufenberg withdrew as counsel for the deft yesterday. 
COURT questions deft regarding counsel. 
Deft states he does NOT wish to be represented by Atty Laufenberg and is in agreement with withdrawal. 
Deft states he wishes to have court appointed counsel. 
COURT advises deft to contact the public defender's office to see if he qualifies for their representation. 
Deft states belief he does NOT qualify for public defender representation. 
COURT advises to still apply for public defender, but sets indigency hearing with belief it will be needed. 
Indigency Hearing set for 12/17/2015 at 10:30 am in Br. 2. 
CC 12/30/2015 at 1pm with Br. 3 JA. 
Bond Continues.
